news_header: The Sphinx snow patch in Scotland has melted for the fourth year in a row, attributed to climate change.
news_text: The Sphinx, a long-lasting snow patch in the UK, has melted for the fourth consecutive year, with Iain Cameron and other experts documenting its changes as part of citizen science. Researchers believe climate change is responsible for the melting of this once-permanent fixture in the Scottish landscape. In related news, various topics are covered including the burial of unknown WW1 soldiers, comedian Janey Godley's health struggles, job losses at Grangemouth, and the performance of Royal Ballet dancer Reece Clarke in Airdrie.
